title: Is SBI Clerk exam more difficult than IBPS Clerk? - Quora

response.answer_text: Are you keen to make a career in the banking sector? If yes, then all of you should know very well about the fact that SBI and IBPS recruitment exams are among the most selected career options among young graduates. Whether you go for IBPS or SBI, both options have very attractive and prestigious career opportunities such as PO, Clerk and SO. But filing the best of these two becomes a daunting task! Based on the different criteria, we have come up with a clear difference between the IBPS clerk prelims exam and the SBI clerk. You can read all the points and analyze yourself with which career option will be meaningful for you and why. In any bank, the clerk is the first checkpoint where customers can ask their questions. Keeping in mind the differences between SBI Clerk prelims exam and IBPS clerk, we have brought some points, where their duties may vary from one another. Please see below - 1. IBPS Clerk: After receiving provisional allocation, the IBPS clerk should be included in the allocated bank within a fixed time period. After this, reputable banks provide them a training about those tasks which they need to do while working as a bank clerk. Detailed guide for IBPS Clerk mains exam 2017-18 will be a useful read to know about state-wise and bank-wise vacancy breakdown. Those who successfully complete their training, will be deployed in different branches of the concerned bank to survive and to complete the probation of the next two years. Therefore, initially, the IBPS clerk is posted at junior level and after completion of their 2 years of probation period, they can be promoted to the upper level. 2. SBI Clerk: SBI clerks are initially appointed in junior level grade and after completing 6 months training, they can be promoted at the officer level. To get an officer grade, they have to pass the internal examination organized on the basis of the structure set out in all the branches of the bank. Clerical staff are considered to be an integral part of the bank workforce because they are responsible for almost every action. The functions and responsibilities of the IBPS clerk mains exam and SBI clerk mains exam are the same. A clerk does most of the work in a bank. Filling entries, handling all cash transactions, handling customers and solving their problems etc. All are done by a clerk.

IBPS Clerk is easy but the SBI has better brand value and salary is also more in it . Compared to SBI Clerks, the work pressure is less for IBPS Clerks working in PSBs. They are assigned time oriented tasks. There might be pressure initially due to more work, but in time the employees will get used to the work schedule and feel relaxed. The working hours are fixed. In case of SBI Clerk, you will be assigned a lot of work on a daily basis and the work intensifies with time. The work is more challenging compared to IBPS Clerks. IBPS Clerk The bank Clerks will be promoted to Officer Cadre in 3-4 years. The clerks can reach the Senior Management position after 20-25 years of working. SBI Clerk In case of SBI, there is a high chance of getting promoted as Trainee Officer in just 3-4 years. Trainee Officer is equivalent to Probationary Officer.
